org.forgerock.openam.utils

Interface CipherProvider

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JCECipherProvider, PerThreadCipherProvider

    public interface CipherProvider
    Abstract factory for obtaining Cipher instances. Implementations may cache or pool ciphers to avoid expensive initialisation overhead. Callers should ensure that they initialise ciphers returned from a cipher provider before making use of them.
    Since:
    12.0.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Cipher getCipher()
      Returns a cipher from the underlying mechanism.

    • Method Detail

      • getCipher

        Cipher getCipher()
        Returns a cipher from the underlying mechanism. The algorithm, padding, and provider used by the cipher are determined by the underlying CipherProvider implementation. The caller should call Cipher.init(int, java.security.Key, java.security.AlgorithmParameters) before making use of the cipher to ensure it is properly initialised.
        Returns:
        a configured cipher or null if a cipher could not be provided.
